metadata.name: The 49th Day
metadata.description:
As the twilight nears, the small monks of Kenchosum monastery, Bumthang in central Bhutan gear up for their evening prayers. I was there in the monastery for the 49th day of offering dedicated to my sister in law who we lost to cancer. Buddhists believe that 49 days is the longest length of time the intermediate state of a dead can last. 

Until we lose a dear one, 
We never accept death as a reality. 

When the tragedy hits,
We shatter in pain, 
We suffer in agony, 
We look for a million answers.

Not approving, 
Life is uncertain, 
Death is certain,
We keep questioning. 

Today, my heart has accepted that death is a part of life. With every death, there is a rebirth. With every celebration of a new born, there was a mourning of a death. It prepared me well when I again lost my father in less than 5 months gap.  

To everyone, who reads this, if you are in the same boat, itâ€™s never too late to accept the Truth. 

Mint  : 1/1 Limited Edition
Print & Signed Copy to buyer
